page.title: 20Social Welfare U. Snodsbury
page.content:
A Mobile library calls twice monthly at Upton Snodsbury and Broughton Hackett and once a month at White Ladies Aston and Churchill. There is a daily postal delivery and a post office in Upton Snodsbury. There is a service of 'Meals on Wheels' three times a week delivered to elderly or infirm people whom doctors think have need of it. Meals are prepared in a central kitchen in Pershore and delivered in specially heated containers by volunteers. There is no doctor's surgery in the area, but patients are covered from the group practices in neighbouring towns.
This survey was made by members of Stoulton & Wadborough Women's Institute.
